summary: The government's public debt will reach 107% of GDP by the end of 2023—its highest point in history—according to the Congressional Budget Office. The growing debt will require attention once the economy has substantially recovered from COVID-19 and public health goals have been achieved. Fiscal rules and targets can help manage debt by controlling factors like spending and revenue. We identified key considerations—like flexibility for...
title: The Nation's Fiscal Health: Effective Use of Fiscal Rules and Targets
